summary: App update to support a pickup-point ordering workflow: pickup points (registered with a town) can view prioritized listings (own-town first, all towns included) and create/checkout orders on behalf of customers, feeding into a shopper/driver status pipeline ending with pickup-point marking order collected.
architectural_notes: Due to platform build limitations, implement the pickup-point dashboard in very small incremental steps (start with an empty route + placeholder, then add data fetching, list rendering, sorting, etc.).
known_issues: Automated builds fail when the request bundles too many changes at once (dashboard + route + components + backend calls/queries).

existing_features.title: Create a new Pickup Point Dashboard page component that renders placeholder content only (no backend calls, no listing queries, no order/cart actions). The page must include a clear H1 title and short description indicating this is the upcoming pickup-point dashboard.

Add a new authenticated route for the Pickup Point Dashboard in the TanStack router configuration (frontend/src/router/HashRouter.tsx). The route must be protected by RequireAuth and render the new placeholder Pickup Point Dashboard page at a stable path (e.g., /pickup-point-dashboard).

new_feature_requests.summary: Pickup-point dashboard to browse all active listings, prioritized by the pickup-pointâ€™s registered town (own-town first, then other towns).
Pickup-point registration requires selecting a town from admin-created towns; saved town is used for dashboard sorting.
Pickup-point order creation/checkout flow from listings (pickup points are the only buyers; customers can browse only).

Order lifecycle/status flow: after pickup-point checkout -> Ready -> Shopper accepted -> Shopper completed -> Driver accepted -> Driver delivered -> Ready for pickup -> Pickup-point marks Collected (end).
Implement build in incremental steps starting with Step 1: create empty pickup-point dashboard route with placeholder text.
